metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the unix-def:file_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the unix-def:file_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity is set to nil.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity matching some regular expression and the filename entity is set to nil.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity equal to some value.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity matching some regular expression and the filename entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the file_object is supported with the max_depth behavior set to a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the file_object is supported with the max_depth behavior set to an unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.
Test that the file_object is supported with filepath entity equal to some value.
Test that the file_object is supported with the filepath entity matching some regular expression.

file_test.comment: Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity is set to nil.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity matching some regular expression and the filename entity is set to nil.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity equal to some value.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity equal to some value and the filename entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the file_object is supported with the path entity matching some regular expression and the filename entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the file_object is supported with the max_depth behavior set to a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the file_object is supported with the max_depth behavior set to an unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.
Test that the file_object is supported with filepath entity equal to some value.
Test that the file_object is supported with the filepath entity matching some regular expression.

file_object.comment: Retrieve a file_item with a path equal to '/bin'.
Retrieve file_items with a path that matches the regular expression '^/b.n$'.
Retrieve a file_item with a path that equals '/bin' and filename that equals 'ls'.
Retrieve file_items with a path that equals '/bin' and filename that matches the regular expression '^l'.
Retrieve file_items with a path that matches the regular expression '^/etc/r' and a filename that matches the regular expression '^r'.
Retrieve a file_item with the path starting at '/etc', recursing down 1 level, and filename that equals 'rc'.
Retrieve a file_item with the path starting at '/etc', recursing down infinitely, and filename that equals 'rc'.
Retrieve a file_item with the path starting at '/etc/rc.d', recursing up 1 level, and filename that equals 'profile'.
Retrieve a file_item with the filepath equal to '/etc/rc.d/rc'.
Retrieve file_items with the filepath matching the regular expression '/etc/ssh/.+'.

file_state.comment: This state represents a file_item which has a path of '/bin'.
This state represents file_items which have a path that matches the regular expression '^/b.n$'.
This state represents a file_item which has a path equal to '/bin', a filename equal to 'ls', and a size greater than '0'.
This state represents file_items which have a path equal to '/bin', a filename that matches the regular expression '^l', and a size greater than '0'.
This state represents file_items which have a path that matches the regular expression '^/etc/r', a filename that matches the regular expression '^r', and a size greater than '0'.
This state represents a file_item which has a path of '/bin', a filename equal to 'ls', and a size greater than '0'.
This state represents a file_item which has a path that equals '/etc/rc.d', a filename that equals 'rc', and a size greater than '0'.
This state represents a file_item which has a filepath equal to '/etc/profile', a path equal to '/etc', a filename equal to 'profile'.
This state represents a file_item with the filepath equal to '/etc/rc.d/rc'.
This state represents a file_item which has a filepath equal to '/etc/rc.d/rc', a path equal to '/etc/ssh', a filename equal to 'sshd_config', and a size greater than '0'.
